name: ffsend
unavailable_reason: Repository is on gitlab. Using deps.dev for cross-forge analysis.

readme.summary: Excellent README with clear purpose, comprehensive examples, and detailed installation instructions across multiple platforms, though configuration details and troubleshooting are less developed.
readme.top_issue: Configuration section is referenced in table of contents but actual configuration documentation is minimal, and troubleshooting section is missing entirely despite being listed in TOC

common_complaints: Upload crashes and segmentation faults (multiple reports across platforms)
Download functionality limitations (CLI download, resume from breakpoint, ZIP handling)
File size discrepancies and download failures
Lack of CLI download capability despite upload feature
Confusion about project infrastructure (GitHub vs GitLab hosting)
praise_themes: Tool usefulness and convenience appreciated by users
Interest in additional features (random service selection, unencrypted mode)
sentiment.summary: The ffsend project shows signs of abandonment with critical stability issues (segfaults on multiple platforms), unaddressed bugs spanning 2+ years, and no maintainer engagement on recent high-priority issues like download failures and crash reports.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from November 2025
32 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicates no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
No releases recorded, suggesting stalled release cycle
maintenance.summary: ffsend appears to be abandoned with no development activity, issue management, or contributor engagement in the past 6 months.

project_metrics.description: :mailbox_with_mail: Easily and securely share files from the command line. A fully featured Firefox Send client.
